oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Alvin C. York, Lasky, and writers

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Men; Dogs
York, Alvin Cullum, 1887-1964; World war, 1914-1918 -- Tennessee -- History; Motion pictures; Lasky, Jesse L., 1880-1958; Lasky, Jesse L., 1910-1988
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Alvin C. York standing with four other men. The man to York's right is Jesse Lasky, legendary film producer, who was the primary producer for the 1941 film, "Sergeant York," about York's exploits in the First World War. Lasky's son, Jesse Jr., stands to the right. The other men are identified as writers. A dog is also in the photograph, standing in front of the men. A building can be seen in the background.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Albert F. Ganier
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pall Mall in Fentress County was Alvin York's hometown. Photographs were taken during a series of meetings between York and Hollywood producers related to a proposed film based on his World War I exploits. Directed by Hollywood veteran Howard Hawks, it starred Gary Cooper as Alvin York. Photograph by Albert Franklin Ganier Sr., who captured the meeting between York and Warner Brothers filmmakers as they researched the film.
